block.p: Tracy Straus, the daughter of Joan Straus Cullman and Barnard S. Straus Sr., both of New York, is to be married today to Steven Postel, the son of Diana Postel of Katonah, N.Y., and the late Dr. Allen H. Postel. Rabbi Ruth Gais will officiate at the home of the bride's mother and stepfather, Joseph F. Cullman 3rd, in New York.

The bride, who will keep her name, is a dance teacher and choreographer with the Aspen Ballet Company in Colorado. She graduated from the University of Michigan at Ann Arbor and received a master's degree in early childhood education from the Bank Street College of Education.

Tracy Straus, the daughter of Joan Straus Cullman and Barnard S. Straus Sr., both of New York, is to be married today to Steven Postel, the son of Diana Postel of Katonah, N.Y., and the late Dr. Allen H. Postel. Rabbi Ruth Gais will officiate at the home of the bride's mother and stepfather, Joseph F. Cullman 3rd, in New York.

The bride, who will keep her name, is a dance teacher and choreographer with the Aspen Ballet Company in Colorado. She graduated from the University of Michigan at Ann Arbor and received a master's degree in early childhood education from the Bank Street College of Education.

Her father, who is retired, was a theatrical producer and a stockbroker at PaineWebber in New York. Her mother is a theatrical producer, a vice chairwoman of the Lincoln Center Theater and a member of the board of the Bay Street Theater in Sag Harbor, N.Y. Her stepfather is the emeritus chairman of the Philip Morris Companies in New York and a trustee of the World Wildlife Fund.

The bride is a granddaughter of the late Nathan Straus Jr., who was the owner of WMCA, a radio station in New York, and a great-granddaughter of Nathan Straus Sr., who was a founder of Abraham & Straus, the former department store chain, and a co-owner of R. H. Macy & Company.

The bridegroom is a guitarist and the lead singer for Little Blue, a rock 'n' roll band, and has also played in the orchestras of Broadway musicals and composed for film and television productions. He graduated from the Mannes College of Music. His father was an associate professor of surgery at New York University Medical Center. He was also the medical director for Goldwater Memorial Hospital in New York and for the New York County Health Services Review Organization. The bridegroom's mother is a painter.
